title: How to Make DIY Firestarters

steps.headline: First you want to cut your wicks to a proper length.
steps.description: About 2 to 3 inches (5.1 to 7.6 cm). Your going to put them in the cup in the shape of a U. This way the ends of the wick stick out of the cup. You can put in one piece of twine, or a second if you want.

steps.headline: Then you are going to want to take your wood shavings or sawdust and fill your paper cup up halfway.
At this point you want to melt your wax.
steps.description: The easiest way is to take pieces of wax and put them in a can (like a soup can) and put that on a hot plate. If you don't have a hot plate you can always get a large candle (not a long tapered candle!) and light it. As it burns a pool of melted wax will form under the candle wick. This can be used as well.

steps.headline: Once you have melted wax you pour it into your paper cups over the woodchips.
steps.description: If there is still room in your cup, you can add more woodchips and wax till it is filled to the top if you would like.

steps.headline: Leave the cups for about ten to twenty minutes to harden and you have a firestarter!
To use the firestarter, just place in your fire like you would do with tinder and light it.

Then you are going to want to take your wood shavings or sawdust and fill your paper cup up halfway.  At this point you want to melt your wax.
